Dgame.Graphics.Sprite



class Sprite: Dgame.Graphics.Transformable.Transformable, Dgame.Graphics.Drawable.Drawable;
Sprite represents a drawable object and maintains a texture and his position.

Author:
rschuett

protected void _positionMoved(float nx, float ny);
Possible observer method if a new position is set.

protected void _positionReset(float dx, float dy);
Possible observer method if the position change.

this();
CTor

this(Texture tex);
CTor

const bool collideWith(const Sprite rhs);
Check whether the bounding box of this Sprite collide with the bounding box of another Sprite

const bool collideWith(const FloatRect rect);
Rvalue version

const bool collideWith(ref const FloatRect rect);
Check whether the bounding box of this Sprite collide with the given Rect

final const pure nothrow ref const(FloatRect) getBoundingBox();
Returns the clip rect, the area which will be drawn on the screen.

final const pure nothrow bool hasTexture();
Check if the current Sprite has already a Texture/Image. If not, nothing can be drawn. But it does not check if the current Texture is valid.

final void setTexture(Texture tex);
Set or replace the current Texture.

final const ref const(Texture) getTexture();
Returns the current Texture or null if there is none.
